alert.note: Alert for Logan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 1:15PM EST until January 01 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTHWEST Kentucky, SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky and south central Kentucky, including the following areas, in NORTHWEST Kentucky, Ohio. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Grayson, Hart and Logan. In south central Kentucky, Butler, Edmonson and Warren. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leitchfield, Morgantown, Brownsville, Anderson, Casey, Lee, Clarkson, Lewisburg, Caneyville and Rochester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
